pullRequest.body:
Discussed in [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2321995.20deprecate.20.60Complex.2Eabs.60/near/500322749).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9e3b44768c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22031/commits/9e3b44768c925b6e1c1c3606c129f2da70a94c99)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Testing to see bot, in case it can be activated before merging.

bors d+

but do not merge!

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think that the idea was that the bot would react *somewhere* on the thread, plus wherever the PR number is mentioned explicitly.

If you think that reacting more is useful, that is easy to change!

@eric-wieser I had not understood your comment: you had indeed identified a bug!

Only the first message *in the relevant `PR review` thread* gets a reaction, even if it does not mention the PR number.  The rest of the emoji reactions are still applied as normal!
Where do you actually check that the title contains the PR number? It looks like you're only checking the whole message at once.
You could consider using `get_stream_topics` which might return all the topics from all time, though I don't know how expensive that is.

You were right again.  I changed the strategy a bit: I loop through the initial filter of all (public) messages that contain `PR number` *somewhere* and I extract the ID of the first time that a message in `PR reviews` has a topic matching the `PR number`.

Using this ID, the logic then stays the same: react to all messages that contain `PR number` in their body and also to the message whose ID has been singled out (if it exists, I assume, I do not know python enough to know what happens if the `specialID` variable is not set, but from a local experiment it looks like it ignores it).
I like this!  With your change, I was able to incorporate the sifting in the main loop!

pullRequest.title: feat(zulip): add emoji reaction to first message
